model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Classmates A:  I can't believe how honored I am to be part of our class. I feel like we have something special going on here.

[MEMORY]
User Description:
Classmates B is a person who enjoys people watching at the mall, has seen a famous celebrity at the local mall, and values their friendship with others. They have also been suggested to go for retail therapy at the mall and are open to unexpected experiences.

Relationship Description:
Classmates A has expressed their feelings of love towards Classmates B, who does not reciprocate those feelings. Despite this, they both value their friendship and have agreed to focus on enjoying time together.

Event Description:
Events shared by Classmates A and Classmates B include planning to go to the mall, reminiscing about old days, and discussing attending a wedding reception. They have also shared moments of honesty and understanding in their interactions. Classmates A has started a new job in marketing for a fashion company, combining their love for fashion and marketing, while Classmates B appreciates their appearance in a black suit for the wedding reception.
